name: Hotel Fuerte Miramar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice Hotel, good location on beach and near old town as well. Room was lovely, breakfast was nice too. Bar was a little bit dead at night time but there are plenty of places to go along the beach if you are looking for something with a bit more atmosphere.
reviews.title: NIce Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008
reviews.text: Efficient check in and very friendly and helpful receptionists.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel right on the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: Clean rooms and very comfortable beds.
reviews.title: not bad for the price, but a bit old fashion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great view over the sea.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Fantastic selection for breakfast.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - GREAT STAFF

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006
reviews.text: We stayed at the Fuerte Miramar for 2 nights in September. It is a lovely hotel, great location on the beach and in the heart of Marbella. Pool is a bit small, but the hotel has sunloungers on the beach. Great bar, and can recommend the SPA! We have booked again for 4 nights in June - so would recommend!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best hotel we stayed in during our trip to southern Spain. We were there the last week of September and there was nothing better than sleeping with our balcony doors open listening to the ocean. Our room was good size, our only "real" double bed on the whole trip (the rest of the hotels we had two singles pushed together). Our toliet didn't flush but we made a call to the front desk and they sent someone up within ten mintues and it was fixxed. Great drinks in the bar. Nice pool. Great beach access. No parking problems. Breakfast expensive unless you want to eat a lot of food. If you just want a yogurt or a bowl of cereal for breakfast, definately not worth it. Go for food in the old town, its better than anywhere we ate right on the beach.
reviews.title: Loved it

likes.liked: — the sound of the ocean in our room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: so disappointed with our stay in this hotel....... moved within five minutes from the room we were given as the air conditioning sounded like a jumbo jet. Our seaview room was small with no tea or coffee making facility...A lot of fuss about the room key and had to use it at all times when using the lift, seperate card for beach towels etc... the lifts were "dodgy" and on one occassion when the whole hotel smelt of smoke I enquired at reception what was going on I was informed that the lift was faulty and was being repaired and thus the overpowering smell. I parked my rented car on the street that night (not that I objected to paying the 6Euro per night charge) but there was no way I would cope with the obnoxious fumes which were even worse in the underground car park..sadly next morning I found my car impounded and three hours later waiting in the police station was forced to pay two hundred euro to get it back......... as far as I am concerned the deadly fumes were the hotels problem and there was not even an apology... I feel they could have called the police and explained the situtation in the hotel that night, but they showed no interest what so ever......... on arrival home I emailed the hotel and received quite a "could'nt care less" reply. They have no idea how to boil water for a cup of tea in this hotel. The beach front restaurant was excellent with bright and cheerful staff on duty evey day, and the maid cleaning the room was also cheerful. The tacky brown bedroom furniture was chipped (maybe the end of a long hot summer) if that is the case reduce your prices.!! and when I book a double bed I want a double bed not two single beds thrown together!!. No way would I ever stay there again well at least not for four star prices for a two star hotel.
reviews.title: not a four star hotel

likes.disliked: — no proper double bed and tacky furniture

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived for a weeks stay in this hotel on the 14th Aug. Although check in was a bit slow with the three staff dealing with one guest at a time this seems to be my only complaint about the staff for the whole week. We were on a bed and breakfast basis which could not be faulted in any way, it was the only time we ate in the hotel. The hotel rooms are very clean and well serviced every day. Location could not be better,right on the beach and a five minute walk from the" Old Town". It is surrounded by a fabulous selection of bars and restaurants particularily on "Orange Square". The pool area is quite small but is well supplied with loungers and towels as is the beach . Entertainment at night in the hotel bar is not great with most guests seeming to head out of the hotel for their nightime fun. During the day the hotel restaurant on the beach is very popular with a wait of up to an hour not uncommon but well worth it. Overall I would go straight back again tomorrow ,and i'm sure this hotel will see me again on my next visit to Spain.
reviews.title: A great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall the hotel is acceptable and I would stay again. We were on the 5th floor.
reviews.title: Nuetral / average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We loved this hotel!!! We were 3 adults traveling. The staff was friendly and helpful. We booked this room directly with the hotel staff. The online reservations were trying to charge the 3rd adult in the room an extra $200 dollars. The rooms were spacious and clean. The pool was nice. The breakfast each morning was included and it was excellent...everything from cereal to eggs, fresh juice etc. for 3 adults. They have a nice spa in the hotel and you can book massages. You can walk to old town from this hotel. You need to take a taxi or bus to Puerto Banues. You can also use the gym in the sister hotel. The gym had excellent exercise classes to take. The beach was NOT the turquoise blue sea we expected like in nice, france or almafi in italy but it was nice.
reviews.title: great hotel!

likes.liked: — The staff, room and location to old town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this hotel is fantastic. On the beach and a two minute walk to the old town area of central Marbella.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel itself is fine but I'm not entirely sure it would be a 4 star in British terms.'
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel Great Location
wonderful hotel
reviews.text: Check in was smooth and friendly even though we were an hour and a half early.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked a room with a front sea view which was considerably more expensive and not justifiably, than a side sea view. When entering our room we went straight to the balcony to see the view. The view was great but we discovered that the walls of the balcony were covered in bird droppings. We informed receception who said they would get it cleaned up. They did but some stains remained on the walls.
reviews.title: Very pleased with Fuerte Miramar Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Could not fault the friendliness of the staff and had a fantastic room with outstanding views. But pool area alot smaller than the sister hotel and therefore felt quite cramped/crowded - the palm trees also meant sun not around for so long. . . but good if you like shade- It was good we were able to use the other hotels facilities as after the first day went there every day.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel but prefered the 'sister' Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast again excellent but not quite such a good selection as sister hotel the outside eating area also lacked the fantastic views of the beach which the sister hotel has.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a week at the end of September and really enjoyed it. The rooms at the front have a fab sea view and are worth the extra few euro. Breakfasts were great with the usual buffet style but with food being replaced constantly and the chef on duty to make omlettes and fried eggs as required. Cava at breakfast was a nice surprise too! The pool area is small enough but ok for that time of year when the hotel wasnt full, also, it is right at the sea so that is another alternative! Location is brilliant being just 5 mins walk from the fab old town and being on the prom also with other bars and restaurants.
reviews.title: pretty good experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Would recommend it and would definitely stay there again, its in a lovely location, relaxing and away from the noise but close enough to the centre of things for some action!
reviews.title: Still a great hotel, but room for minor improvements

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a reservation for 4 nights, and at our arrival, around 12 midnight the guy at the front des was very apologetic that there was only one room left. (it looked like a single room to me although we reserved a standard double) He insisted that we do get to change our room next morning. Next morning the gave us a double room with a view to compensate. I found that pretty nice from their side.
reviews.title: Dont expect any frills here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location in Marbella for accessing the Marina, the promenade and the old town.
reviews.title: Good location - not quite 4 star standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It cost us 62 Euro to get from the airport to the hotel and 52 Euro on the way back!
reviews.title: Honest review of the Miramar Spa in Marbella

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: Hotel wasn't full - mainly Spanish, American and Irish when we were there.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: Hotel Room was OK, very clean and had everything you needed.
reviews.title: Made our holiday in Marbella

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: Hotel Breakfast - which we chose to have delivered to our room was either wrong or late nearly every morning. Very pleased that we didn't have to pay for it to be delivered so we reasoned the mistakes could be lived with and if we'd have been really bothered we'd have gone down to the restaurant.
reviews.title: Not bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Fuerte Miramar in Marbella for 5 days in early September. This was our second trip to the hotel in a little over a year, we had high expectations from our previous stay. We were not disappointed. From the moment we arrived, we were made very welcome by the staff at reception. We had booked a side sea room directly on the hotel’s website and got exactly what we ordered. The late check out option suited us perfectly as we had a late flight back to Ireland. The room was very comfortable and fully soundproofed. Located on the 4th floor beside the elevator, we didn’t hear any noise for the duration of the stay. Breakfast was very tasty, with a wider selection/better quality of food you would experience in the majority of 5 Star hotels. The omelettes and pancakes are well recommended – they are prepared by a chef in front of your eyes. The pool area is a little small and was quite congested during this peak period, but there was a very friendly atmosphere and the waiters were very hospitable. Very nice to chill out there and have a drink on the patio beside the bar. We ate lunch a number of days at the beach club restaurant – try the Seabass or Sardines which are cooked on the BBQ. We found the staff here a little on the arrogant side – our only complaint during our stay but the quality of the food and wine more than made up for this. Finally, the location is superb. About 200 metres from the entrance to the old town and only a 5 minute taxi ride to Marbella bus station. Fuerte Miramar is an excellent base to explore Marbella and Audulucia at an affordable price.
reviews.title: Great base to explore Marbella at an affordable price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I have be staying at this hotel every year since it opened and it is always a joy to return and standards have remained consistently high and good value for money in such a fantastic location. The staff are charming from the ever helpful and welcoming reception team who sort out any problems and also give advice on trips and sort out restaurant reservations etc, to the friendly bar and restaurant staff who make a solo traveller feel at ease. The rooms are spotless and the addition of the welcome pack and tea making facilities is great and it is fantastic view from the balcony and falling asleep to the sound of the sea is perfect.
reviews.title: Great hotel and stunning location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pool area good always beds available ,lots ot towels and pool staff sort out umbrellas also lots of fun events round the pool ,wine tasting,making sangria and gapacho. Great beach
reviews.title: great service and unbelievable value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: restaurant, sardines , sea bass and squid a must to try. The Spa is on site and standard of
reviews.title: Very Enjoyable Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: treatments is high and can even have a massage up to 8pm. The gym at the sister hotel is a
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I personally think greed has set in. Nice hotel but expensive.Barfood little choice and overpriced, drinks are also expensive. They should look at these issues for they certainly were not doing much business at night.
reviews.title: Beware of hidden charges Teasmade & cookie

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What really annoyed me was when checking out charging for the teasmade.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Marbella

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Location
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked into the Fuerte Miramar Spa in Marbella in early June 2009 for 3 nights. The location of the hotel is excellent right on the beach and close to the shops and amenities. We normally stay at the older Fuerte Hotel, 50 metres away but decided to give the sister hotel a try. We drove from the airport and parked in the hotel car park at a nightly charge.
reviews.title: Enjoyable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Checking in
reviews.title: Very fine hotel with a good location
Overnight Stay
reviews.text: We only stayed at the hotel for one night, but it was a nice break on a three week tour of Spain. Of course, in November the weather was not

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007
reviews.text: ideal for swimming or sunbathing, but we did enjoy our brief stop on the Costa del Sol. The hotel gave us a very good room rate. When we checked in they assigned us a great room with a balcony that overlooked both the coast and the sea. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We parked in the garage right next to the hotel. It has an elevator to the reception area which made it nice and convenient. The breakfast buffet was excellent. The hotel had internet service for a fee. The evening show didn't interest us much but the room seemed to be full of guests enjoying themselves. We were surprised that so many of the service staff in Marbella come from countries other than Spain. They appear to hire English speaking staff to accommodate their guests, but It does dilute the Spanish experience. As a result, Marbella feels somewhat like an outpost of the U.K. We enjoyed the experience of talking with other English speaking guests, but wouldn't have wanted to spend an extended period of time in Marbella unless we just wanted a beach experience.
reviews.title: Great Location, Room Dismal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I stayed at the Fuerte Miramar Spa for 3 nights. I booked about a week before using Travel Republic, they only had one room option which was standard. The picture looked great and the location was fantastic - right on the beach. I arrived on the Friday morning and was delighted that my room was ready and on the 2nd floor. There is an extra charge of £2 per day for the safe, which is operated using your room card. You also get cards for the pool towels. Reception spoke good english and were very polite.
reviews.title: Great location and hotel

likes.liked: — The service, accommodations and views from the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Staff could not have been more helpful. Fully merited 4star rating. We were a group of 8 people from Cork in Ireland on our annual golf trip to the Costa but on our first trip to Marbella. Our booking was on a b/b basis and as we tended to burn the midnight oil we found that the breakfast up to 11.00am was a great idea. Breakfast was top class and kept us fortified up to our evening meal. Great choice of restaurants nearby but even though it is lovely up around the famous Orange Square the dinner prices here are a bit over the top. Hotel is situated right on the beachfront and you can enjoy a relaxing stroll on the promenade at your leisure. Indeed a few of us walked into Puerto Banus from the hotel...obviously with a few pit stops on the way for fear of dehydration. The Spa is excellent for getting rid of all those aches and pains and the treatments are top class.I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to all ages.
reviews.title: Top class Hotel ideally located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Just returned from a five day break at this hotel and I must say we had a great stay. The hotel is very clean and well maintained. The breakfast is fantastic and the quality on offer at the buffet is really good. The staff are really helpful and very efficient. We sat by the pool most days and although the pool area is very small, it never seemed too busy. Pool towels are provided free of charge. This hotel is right on the beach front which is also a plus and only a five minute walk from the old town. This hotel is geared for families and those looking for a quiet spot which was just what I was looking for. There is nightly entertainment in the bar which was ok but there is lots more to do exploring the bars and restaurants of Marbella. Rooms are comfortable and clean but do not expect anything amazing but hey this is a four star hotel and an excellent four star at that!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel
Fantastic Hotel
reviews.text: I also used the Spa which is reasonable and the staff were great. Guests can use the gym at the sister hotel which is a five minute walk away. The gym was the best hotel gym I have ever used. Brilliant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I ate lots of nice food in Marbella and if you are a foodie like me you have to try the Orange Tree restaurant in the old town. Excellent food, some may find it pricey but I think well worth a visit, you wont be disappointed.
reviews.title: What a lovely hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, this hotel is well worth a visit, provides excellent value for money, comfort, excellent breakfast and great staff.
reviews.title: Great Bargain for a Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Fuerte Miramar Hotel for 5 nights at the end of April and got an extremely good rate on bookings.com, so good in fact that we were only expecting it to be a very average hotel. We were pleasantly surprised.
reviews.title: Great Value, Great Location, Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: On arrival, we were greeted by very friendly staff at reception with very good English; we found them to be extremely helpful and friendly throughout our stay. Our room was spacious, very clean and tastefully decorated. The bathroom was also quite large with a good selection of toiletries and towels available. The pool area is well maintained and beautifully laid out; towels were free for hotel guests with a lot of bar staff on hand to serve a nice chilled drink as you soak up the sun! The buffet breakfast each morning was exceptional and was served from 7.30 am to 11 am with food in full supply right to the end of service.
reviews.title: Just good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel’s location is perfect – right beside the beach and a 3 minute walk from the Old Town. One is spoiled for choice also on the restaurant front; Messina is literally beside the hotel with other good eateries (The Orange Tree & Buenaventura to name but a few) around the vicinity of The Orange Square in the Old Town. The bar food in the hotel itself I must say is poor, on arrival we had a beef burger which was inedible, and a vegetarian pasta dish which was equally as bad. I had read about the bar food on other posts on Tripadvisor so I can only blame myself for ordering a meal here.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!
Good Hotel
reviews.text: That aside, I would definitely recommend this hotel and look forward to another visit soon.

reviews.title: great place to stay
reviews.text: Just a good hotel, but nothing special. Crew in reception was very friendly and useful. Rooms are small, clean and suficient. Good breakfast. The hotel is just in front of the sea, and few minutes walking from the city center of Marbella.

description: Modern and functional 4 star hotel, on the beachfront and in the centre of Marbella. 226 rooms equipped with central climatization (cold in summer and hot in winter), beds with duvet cover and mattress with quilted cover, telephone, kettle, minibar, safety box (extra), music channel, hairdryer, satellite TV, pay TV and Internet connection WIFI in 50% of the rooms (extra), cot (free of charge on request), Baby carriage, cot and baby bath free (depending on availability). Hotel facilities: restaurant with terrace, lobby bar, piano bar (daily live music and free WIFI connection), entertainment activities for children (high season), cot, TV room, outdoor heated pool, sunbeds by the pool, sunbeds on the beach (extra in July, August and September), beach bar restaurant grill (closed in December and January), lounges, shop, cyber room (extra), WIFI in common areas, garage (extra). Fully equipped Hydrotherapy - SPA centre (extra) with sauna, Jacuzzi, Turkish bath hydro-massage pool, massages, beauty treatments, hairdresser (extra), etc... Free use of the Sports Center at the sister Hotel Fuerte Marbella (300 mtrs. way). Discounted rates at most of the golf courses in the area. Half board consists of breakfast and dinner, except July and August when guests can choose between lunch or dinner.
